title: Calories in Two Slices of Bacon
meta_description: Discover calories in two slices of bacon, including full nutrition breakdown like fat, protein, sodium, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in Two Slices of Bacon
assumptions: Standard pork bacon, pan-fried until crisp; average slice ~8 g uncooked weight.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, thickness, cooking method, and fat drainage. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two slices of pan-fried bacon provide ~86 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp maple syrup per slice

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal per slice of pan-fried pork bacon.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in two slices of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 6.6 g total fat, including 2.2 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yes—frying retains more fat than baking or microwaving with drainage.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in two slices of bacon?
faqs.a: Around 384 mg, which is notable for low-sodium diets.
Turkey or plant-based bacon options can cut calories by 20–50% per slice.
